alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 30 at 8:34AM CDT until November 01 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .The Yellow River at Necedah crested on Sunday. This river will continue a slow fall and it will likely fall below flood stage on Wednesday afternoon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 16.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM CDT Monday was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue falling to 11.3 feet Monday, November 06. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.3 feet on 05/03/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CDT.
